text: Nara Falcón (born 19 December 1982) is a Mexican former synchronized swimmer. Nara competed in the women's duet at the 2004 Olympic Games with her partner Olga Vargas and finished in sixth place. In 2010 she won the gold medal in duet the FINA world master championships celebrated in Gottemborg In 2012 she won the gold again in trio the FINA world master championships celebrated in Rimini Italy Since her retirement from the pool, Nara has appeared as a host on several TV shows. The most popular is the Mexican reality TV show La Isla 2014. In Spain, she hosts a daily magazine show called "A las 11 con". == References == Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:Mexican synchronized swimmers Category:Olympic synchronized swimmers of Mexico Category:Synchronized swimmers at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:Sportspeople from Mexico City Category:Synchronized swimmers at the 2003 Pan American Games
title: Nara Falcón
